loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which has a high regional output of maize. He has three children and has been doing this work for five years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops and a personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Poultry keeping." His biggest challenge is poultry diseases. An animal on the farm has been given the name of Chebanan.

Cyrus was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Because it offers affordable loans to farmers." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Importance of directing loans to the intended projects."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, "How will this loan benefit his family?" Cyrus replied, "Income from the poultry project will help me educate my children and expand my hotel business."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Cyrus owns the following: cow, poultry and bicycle, but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, electricity, a TV and DVD, but does not have solar power, running water or a sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Martha. She is married and has two children, aged 5 and 12. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she is helping a sister with her education. 

In 2011, Martha established her food and drinks business. She began her business to be self-reliant after graduating from technical vocational school. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about 1,855,400 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Martha requires a loan in order to pay for rice, palm oil and soft drinks. She hopes that this loan can increase the stock and improve on the profit. In the future, Martha plans to increase the business and expand the business, and hopes to be able to take care of the children and help her husband run the home. She started the business with a few cups of rice and now has a food shop where she also sells drinks. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for food and drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To hire laborers for the farm.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 51 años es una mujer alegre. Ella tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos: Yurica y Liz a las que cuida en casa de su madre desde hace 13 años.Su madre hace muchos años viajo al extranjero y es alli donde vive en la actualidad, por ello ella tuvo que encargarse de los bienes de la familia. Gracias a sus 7 parcelas, puede sembrar maíz, papa y habas en cantidad. Cuida con mucho esmero, pues es uno de los mejores de la zona. Cuenta que en donde gana más dinero, es en el maíz, ya que hace secar para venderlos por arrobas, eso es su técnica. También cría animales, ya tienen varias gallinas, 40 cuyes y 10 conejos, los cuales le brindan ganancias extra, ya que los engorda para luego vender a un mayor precio en la ciudad de Lima y Cerro de Pasco donde tiene buenos clientes, además aprovecha para visitar a sus hijos.Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, pues hace posible que continúe con su trabajo. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Gloria, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos de maíz.
texts.en:
Gloria, 51, is a cheerful woman. She has 5 children, but only lives with 2 of them: Yurica and Liz whom she has been taking care of in her mother's house for 13 years. Her mother has been traveling abroad for many years and that is where she lives now, as she had to be in charge of the family property.

Due to her 7 plots, she can grow corn, potatoes, and beans in large quantities. She takes very good care of them as it is one of the best in the area. She says she earns more money with the corn, since she dries and sells them for arrobas (Spanish measuring system), that is her technique. She also raises animals. She already has several chickens, 40 guinea pigs and 10 rabbits, which bring her extra income. She fattens them and then sells them for a higher price in the city of Lima and Cerro de Pasco where she has good customers. She also takes advantage of visiting her children. 

This is her second loan with KIVA. She is very grateful for your support because it makes it possible for her to continue with her work. In addition she promises to be punctual with the monthly payments. 

Gloria, will invest 500 Peruvian Soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer for her corn crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Guerreros De La Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es: Ruth, que se encuentra al costado izquierdo de la foto con una bufanda morada y con carpeta en mano, pertenece al Banco Comunal Guerreros de la Fe y la Esperanza, dentro del cual, hay negocios tales como la venta de mariscos, ropa nueva, papel higiénico y artículos de aseo, y Ruth vende calcetas y medias en la feria libre. Ella comenzó con su negocio hace poco, incitada por un amigo que le ayudo a emprender con este negocio. No ha tenido problemas con su negocio. El préstamo que ha solicitado lo ocupará para comprar más mercadería para su negocio, con este dinero espera que le vaya muy bien. Lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza ha sido la responsabilidad con la que la han acogido, y que la incentiven a trabajar en su negocio y le entreguen las herramientas necesarias para salir adelante.
texts.en: Ruth, who is on the left of the photo with the purple scarf and a folder in her hand, belongs to the Guerreros de la Fe y Esperanza Communal Bank. The businesses of the members include: seafood; new clothing; and  toilet paper and personal hygiene products. Ruth sells socks and stockings in the market. She started her business a short time ago at the encouragement of a friend who helped her to start it up. She has not had problems with her business. She will use this loan to buy more merchandise for her business. She hopes that it will go very well for her. What she has most enjoyed about working with Fondo Esperanza has been the responsibility she has taken on, the incentive to work in her business, and the fact that she is given the necessary tools to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy socks and stockings for her business.

loans.name: Katty Suliman

texts.es: Doña katty de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación lugar en el cual una de sus hijas le ayuda a repartir las tortillas, sobre todo en los fines de semana. katty desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobre todo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y asi ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Katty, 35, lives in her own house with her husband and three children. She has a tortilla shop where she is in charge of making tortillas every noontime and every night. Her business is located in her house. One of her daughters helps her distribute tortillas, mainly on the weekends. Katty wishes to improve her business as it provides her with a very stable income, which allows her to support her family. 

She is requesting a loan so she can purchase corn and lime at wholesale in order to make a larger amount of tortillas. On the weekends the demand increases because many others tortilla shops are closed and thus she can obtain greater profits which will allow her to improve her economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase corn and lime at wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Eduvigis

texts.es:
José, es una persona muy luchadora, reconocida en la comunidad por su honradez  y responsabilidad, está casado pero debido a problemas familiares se separo de su esposa  y tiene dos hijos, los cuales no están con él, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica  a las actividades agropecuarias, comercialización de ganado y cerdos, este lo realiza desde hace 21 años, el cual lo heredo de sus padres, anteriormente le ayudaba su esposa e hijos, hoy lo desempeña pagando mano de obra.
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas, entre otros; este le ayudara  a obtener una cosecha  abundante y libre de plagas para la venta y el consumo, uno de los principales riesgos son los cambios de clima que intervienen en la producción.
Su sueño es trabajar mucho para incrementar sus cosechas y principalmente sus ingresos  para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos, asimismo crear un negocio rentable para obtener mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
José is a hardworking person, known by locals as an honest and responsible person. He is married, but due to family problems he is separated from his wife, with whom he has two children that do not live with him. José does not have relatives abroad. He has been working in agriculture since he was 21, selling cattle and pigs, an activity he inherited from his parents. His wife and children used to help him, but now he has to pay somebody else to do it.

José is requesting a loan to buy compost, insecticides, pesticides, etc. in order to have a more abundant harvest, free from plagues, and sell it. One of his biggest challenges is the changing weather, especially when it affects his production.

His dream is to work hard in order to improve his harvests and his income, improve his children’s living conditions and create a profitable business that leaves better profits.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is originally from Peru and has been living in the States for the past 12 years. She has 30 years of experience in the daycare sector. 

Aurea has been working to launch her own daycare for the past year. She has a location in the neighborhood of Columbia Heights in Washington, DC. The location was previously a hair salon and now is completely renovated to be a daycare. 

The loan will help Aurea to cover the remaining project costs, such as purchasing cribs, furniture, toys, etc. to allow Aurea to open the doors to her daycare. 

Aurea will begin her daycare with 5 children and hopes in the future to operate at full capacity, which is 18 children.

loans.use: to launch her own daycare.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Doña magdalena de 44 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija de 21 años de edad en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas, tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación. Doña magdalena solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
Magdalena, 44, lives together with her husband and her 21-year-old daughter in a house of their own. She runs a store at home where she sells food products such as bread, beverages, different types of oil, vegetable, fruits and sweets, and also consumer goods such as soap and shampoo.

Magdalena is requesting a loan to stock her store in order to provide a better service, increase her sales and get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy soups, coffee, corn, beans, eggs, milk, pies, chocolate, etc.

loans.name: Reina Patricia

texts.es: Doña reina de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, ella se dedica  a la venta de todo tipo de ropa y accesorios como pulseras, aritos, cadenas, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar, doña reina solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar más mercadería para surtir su negocio y asi complacer a su clientela cuando la busquen para comprar y poder obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a darle a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Reina, 35 years old, lives in her own home with her two children ages 7 and 3. She works by selling all kinds of clothes and accessories such as bracelets, earrings, necklaces, and more. Her business is located in the market near her home. With the profits she earns from her sales, she is able to pay household expenses. Reina is requesting a loan so she can buy more merchandise to stock her business and satisfy her customers when they shop. This will help her earn a better income and help her to provide her children with more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes and accessories such as bracelets, earrings, necklaces, and more.

loans.name: Dúo El Calvario Group

texts.es: Dúo el Calvario, este grupo esta conformado por el señor Jorge Anibal de 57 años de edad, el se dedica a la venta de productos de comestibles de consumo diario, el tiene ya barios años de dedicarse a esta actividad ya que como actividad secundaria el se dedica al transporte, el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la venta.
texts.en:
Jorge Aníbal, 57, is a member of Dúo El Calvario.  He makes a living selling food products for daily consumption.

He has worked in this job for several years.  He works in transportation as a secondary job.

He's requesting this loan to buy food products to sell.

loans.use: to buy food to sell

loans.name: Jessica Albertina

texts.es:
Jessica, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en la agricultura y por la buena atención que la Institución le brinda; este le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas.
El crédito le ayudo a aumentar la producción, sus ganancias las invirtió en comprar medicamentos para un niño que se le enfermo; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han cambiado.
texts.en:
Jessica is asking for a new loan because she needs to invest in her farming and because of the good service she gets from the institution.  This will allow he to buy farming supplies such as compost, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides.  

The previous loan helped her increase production and she used her earnings to buy medicine for her sick son.  Her financial and family circumstances have changed.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.es:
Nazaria es madre y padre para sus dos hijos pues su pareja los abandono pero, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que desde muy temprana edad se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, a la ganadería y a la agricultura y le va excelente. Desde hace varios años  que pertenece al banco comunal “El Balcon” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. 

Nazaria nació en el distrito de Challabamba pero vive en la comunidad de Majopata anexo de la comunidad de Carnicero. (La comunidad de Majopata está ubicada en el distrito del Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Nazaria is a mother and father to her two children because her husband abandoned her but she is a hardworking, enterprising woman who learned how to care for small animals and farm at an early age.  Things are going excellent for her.  She has been  a member of the "El Balcon" communal bank for a number of years and she needs this loan to buy small animals, such as Guinea pigs and chickens.

Nazaria was born in the Challabamba district, but lives in the Majopata community, an annex of the Carnicero community.  (The Majopata community is located in the Challabamba district of the Puncartambo province, within the Cusco department of Peru.)

loans.use: To buy small animals.

loans.name: Cielo Azul Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores, trabajadores una de ellas es Yokasta mujer de 47años de edad, soltera, tiene tres años de fabricar y vender bolsos, los productos los vende en el mercado oriental de la capital, su crédito lo invertirá en  la compra de materia prima como 50 yardas de tela, 30 yardas de zipper, 8lbs de forros, 3 docenas de reguladores de plásticos, 3 yardas de tela de cuerina etc., Humberto hombre de 32 años y su negocio es la venta de pantalón y Carla tiene 30 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de miel de abeja.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising, hardworking members.   Yokasta is one of them and she is 47 years old, single, and has been making and selling purses for three years.  She sells her products in the capital city's original market.  She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as 50 yards of fabric, 30 yards of zipper, 8 lbs of covering, 3 dozen plastic fasteners, 3 yards of leather, etc.

Humberto is 32 years old and sells pants; Carla is 30 and sells honey.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Vilma Haydee

texts.es:
Vilma, vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 10 y 12 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de tamales de elote, inicio esta actividad hace 12 años y lo realiza de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo que requiere optar le permitirá comprar elotes, aceite, leña, frijol, papas, pollo, entre otros; este le ayudara para ofrecerle calidad de producto a la clientela y así aumentarla poco a poco, no tiene ninguna dificultad por el momento.
Su sueño es continuar trabajando en su negocio y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma lives with her life partner and two children who are 10 and 12. She has been selling sweet corn tamales for twelve years, working Monday to Sunday.

Vilma is requesting a loan to buy sweet corn, oil, firewood, beans, potatoes and chicken, among other things. This way, she will be able to offer her customers a good product, which will, little by little, attract more customers. She does not face any difficulties right now.

Vilma’s dream is to continue working with her business and helping her family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy sweet corn, oil, firewood, beans, potatoes, chicken and other supplies to make tamales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Clarese

texts.en:
In her hometown of Alexandria, Louisiana, Clarese owns a full-service beauty parlor, where her clients can enjoy not just a style and a cut, but after the help of an Accion Texas Inc. loan, a massage as well.

It was a long-time goal for Clarese to open a shop of her own. Styling hair since she was 12 years old, Clarese received her cosmetology license in 2003, when she was 23. Clarese finally opened her one-of-a-kind parlor as the opportunity presented itself in 2011.

The parlor offers two rooms, one for chemical-free, natural hair treatment, and the other for traditional barber shop services, which also includes the newly added massage bed. Clarese also provides her clients with healthy beverages and snacks.

With the added service, Clarese expects business to grow enough that she plans to hire four employees in a month. After receiving her Accion loan, she hired two employees, one to offer massages. 

Clarese was also able to purchase a barber’s chair, towels and a towel steamer, an aromatherapy machine, oils and sheets.

loans.use: to purchase a massage table and hire a masseuse.

loans.name: José Marío

texts.es:
José tiene 34 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Desde muy pequeño a trabajado en la agricultura junto a su hermanos; debido a que su padre los abandono y ellos se vieron obligados a trabajar para sostener a la familia. A los 13 años de edad trabajo como cobrador en un autobús, al os 23 años de edad empezó a trabajar en la agricultura y a los 24 años se caso y procreo dos hijos. Los insumos agrícolas los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a 6 kilómetros de su casa; Luigi tiene que pagar transporte para que los traslade a su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, abonos, semillas para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con el crédito pretende mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, al recibir mejores ingresos económicos podrá comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
José is 34 years old, married and has two children. He has worked in agriculture since he was a kid, together with his siblings. Since their father abandoned them, they had to work in order to support their family. When he was 13, he worked in a bus, collecting the fare. When he was 23, he started working in agriculture, and when he turned 24, he got married and had two children. He buys the agricultural supplies in a city located six kilometers from his house, so he has to pay to transport them back home.

José is requesting a loan to Fundación Campo to buy fertilizers, compost and seeds in order to grow corn in a 14,000 m2 [150,000 ft2] piece of land. With the loan, he hopes to improve his family’s quality of life. With a better income, he will be able to buy a piece of land and build a house there.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost and seeds to grow corn in a 14,000 m2 piece of land.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is married. She runs a kiosk which helps her to generate income for her family. Jacinta will use the loan to buy stocks of items such as tissue, pants, shorts, short dresses, and other clothes to keep in her store. She opened her clothing kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Jacinta is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy tissue, pants, shorts, short dresses, and other clothes.

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.es: Giovanni, está casado, vive con su esposa y su hijo que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como abonos, plaguicidas y herbicidas para la asistencia de su plantación de café. El cuenta con el terreno ya apto para la explotación de este cultivo y está en producción pero en condiciones regulares. El tiene pensado que con estos productos pueda mejorar su cosecha al máximo para este año y así obtener más ganancias para su bienestar y a la vez brindarle cada día una mejor calidad de vida a sus familiares.  Es ya ha tenido varios préstamos de FUDECOSUR. El si había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Giovanni is married and lives with his wife and son.  They are his top priorities.  He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as compost, pesticides, and herbicides to help out his coffee crops.  He has good farmland on which to grow this crop and produce regularly.  He believes that he can improve these products and improve his harvest to maximum this year and be able to obtain greater earnings for his wellbeing and provide a better quality of life to his family.  He has had several loans through FUDECOSUR.  He has had prior loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided loans with greater ease and at much lower better interest rates.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Ameanata

texts.en:
Ameanata is 43 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources, has living conditions that are much better than the capital city, and is the second largest populated county in Liberia. She did not go to school and she has lived all her life in a rural area. Traditionally, she is married, and her husband is a farmer. They have six children; she does not know their ages, she said, and none of her children are in school.

From selling her husband's farm products, she was able to establish her business. Since 2010, she has been running a table where she sells palm oil, vita and pepper. She spends nine hours on her business. A problem she faces is her small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for her business. Her plan is to one day send her children to vocation school.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Lisset

texts.es: Lisset, de 23 años, es una hija ejemplar. Vive desde hace 15 años en la casa de su tio junto a su madre.Su principal actividad económica de Lisset, es la crianza de pollos, los que cuida en su misma casa durante sus tiempos libres, “no requiere de mucha atención, solo tengo que alimentar y sacarlos al aire libre en la mañana y guardarlos en la noche para que descanses”, afirma. Es así que cada 3 meses vende los más maduros a los clientes que posee, su trabajo es rotativo, por ello tiene que comprar más pollos para poder criarlos para poder abastecer a sus clientes.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo amanecer” y este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, le gusta trabajar en su asociación, pues las personas que lo conforman son responsables y siempre se apoyan entre ellas en cada reunión que tienen, por esa razón promete ser puntual en sus cuotas.Lisset, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de pollos, comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
Lisset, 23, is an exemplary daughter.  She has lived for 15 years with her mother in her uncle's house.

Lisset's main job is raising chickens, which she cares for at her house in her spare time.  "It doesn't require a lot of attention.  I only have to feed them and take them outside in the morning, and protect them at night so they rest," she says.

Every three months she sells the oldest ones to her customers.  Her work rotates, so she has to buy more chickens to raise and be able to supply her customers.

She belongs to Nuevo Amanecer Communal Bank and this is her second loan with Kiva.  She likes to work with her bank because the members are responsible and always support each other mutually in their meetings.  This is why she promises to make her payments punctually.

Lisset will invest the 1000 soles [PEN] in buying chickens and balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy chickens and balanced feed

loans.name: Petrona Del Carmen

texts.es:
Petrona, es una humilde artesana dedicada a la producción de zapatos, en la ciudad de Granada, casada madre de 5 hijos  de los cuales dos están estudiando los demás trabajan con ella en el taller de zapatos. Inicio su negocio junto con su esposo ella anteriormente vendía carne con este negocio fue que creció ya que su familia vendía carne. Al casarse su esposo trabaja en un taller de zapatos así que ambos unieron capital y decidieron poner su propio taller de zapatos en el trabajan sus hijos también. Este es el único medio de subsistencia de hoy en día. Ellos venden dentro y fuera de Managua para conseguir nueva rutas de mercado.
Ella está solicitando el crédito para comprar cuero, pegamento, suelas, ebilla, pegamento para zapatos. Desea cumplir con los pedidos que tienen y el crédito le permitirá tener materia prima para trabajar. Pues tiene como planes ampliar su taller y brindar empleo a nuevos artesanos y ofrecer variedad de estilos para damas y caballeros promoviendo calzado nacional.
texts.en:
Petrona is a humble artisan who makes shoes in the city of Granada. She is married and has five children; two are studying and the rest help her at the workshop. Petrona started this business together with her husband. She sold meat before, which was her family’s business. When she got married, her husband worked in a shoe workshop; they joined forces and decided to start their own workshop, where their children also work. This is how the family makes a living today, selling in Managua and the surroundings and looking for new markets.

Petrona is requesting a loan to buy leather, glue, soles and buckles. She wants to fulfill all the orders they have and the loan will help them to have all the raw material they need to work. Her plans are to enlarge the workshop and employ new artisans, and to offer a wide variety for men and women, promoting the local shoe industry.

loans.use: to buy leather, glue, soles and buckles to make shoes.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 23 years old and married with two children. He is into farming and started in 2008 after dropping out of school because his parents did not have money to pay his school fees. He has been growing mainly maize, beans and cassava on a small scale as a major source of income to look after his family.

Gerald wants a loan of 1,000,000 shillings to be used in the weeding of his maize by paying workers as well as expanding his garden. His dream is to start growing on a large scale for commercial purposes so that he can realise good returns from the business.

However, Gerald is always challenged by the changing weather conditions, the seasonality of agriculture production as well the price fluctuations on the market.

loans.use: Tp pay laborers for weeding the plantation.

loans.name: Pakanac Group

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena es de estado civil casasa, tiene 55 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos y ni 1 de ellos esta estudiando, ella se dedica al comercio, especificamente vende ropara para damas. Inició este negocio vendiendo ropa con su madre y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solitica un prestamo que lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería como blusas, delantales, cortes, fajas etc. en el futuro desea tener una tienda de ropa en el centro de la ciudad; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y actividaes pecuarias. Hago mencion que en la fotografia figuran 11 integrantes, pero solamente a 10 de ellas se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Magdalena is married and 55 years old.  She has five children and none attend school.  She is a merchant, sells women's clothing, started this business with her mother, and has 10 years' experience.

She is a member of a group and is asking for a loan so she can buy merchandise such as blouses, aprons, shorts, girdles, etc.  In the future she wants to open a clothing store downtown.  The other members are also merchants and have their own businesses.  It pays to say that there are eleven people in the photograph, but only 10 received loans.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina es una mujer de 25 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amble, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde para ayudar a su familia, Marcelina no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho que desea, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pescado Frito para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Marcelina trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa para bebes, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Marcelina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería, como baberos, ajuares, babuchas y otros, de esta manera Marcelina tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 25, is single and lives in the city of Ica with her parents and siblings.  She's a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic woman with a great desire for self-improvement.  Unfortunately, Marcelina hasn't been able to study law as she would like to because she lacked financial resources and needed to work to help her family.  In her free time she likes to play sports, and sometimes she cooks a delicious fried fish to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Marcelina works in her small business selling baby clothing.  She works every day for approximately eight hours and believes it's going well for her because of her good prices and friendly treatment of others.

Marcelina's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy more merchandise such as bibs, layettes, and other things.

This way Marcelina's business will be better stocked and she'll be able to take care of more customers and continue working and making the effort to realize her big dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Edward. He is married and has three children, aged 2, 5 and 13. He has two additional dependents, who live with him because he is helping a sister with her children's education. 

In 2005, Edward established his drinks and beverages, musical set rental and chair rental business. He began his business to be self-reliant after graduating from college with no job. His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about 703,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Edward requires a loan in order to pay for additional soft drinks and beverages. He hopes that this loan can improve the production and add to the profit. In the future, Edward plans to improve the business and expand, hopes to be able to take care of the children and open another outlet within the town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for soft drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en:
Growing up, Cindy’s parents taught her the value of hard work and ambition. Her parents raised her to know that she could do anything she put her mind to, and she dreamed of living many places and experiencing life to the fullest.

After she and her husband, Ves, married almost three years ago, they wanted to take their experience in the food industry and create their own unique business. Her husband’s Cambodian-American background gave them both a love for Southeast Asian food, in particular pho, or Vietnamese rice noodles. Their shared passion for food instilled in them a desire to provide quality service and experience, while contributing more to the community.  

Although both Cindy and her husband loved the idea of opening a food truck, they decided to start small and opened a food tent instead.  Just last week, Cindy and her husband launched their food tent, Pho Realz. With this business, they can set up shop at local farmers’ markets and share their love for pho.

In opening their own business, Cindy and her husband have faced some financial challenges, including finding the capital to start. Furthermore, she shared that their biggest struggle is getting the word out about their unique, local food tent. However, she enjoys the challenge and is committed to the long-term success of her business.

Cindy finds value and passion in partnering with the local community and giving back. She has already worked with a local artist to design their logo, and has a deep appreciation for a locally oriented, hospitable mindset. She hopes for the future that her business can continue to share a love of culture and give back to the community.

With your help, Cindy and her husband can pay for a vehicle to transport their food and tent supplies; also equipment and start-up food and licensing costs. Your contributions will directly enable Cindy and her husband to provide quality food at local farmers’ markets.

loans.use: to pay for a vehicle to transport their food and tent supplies; also equipment and start-up food and licensing costs.

loans.name: John B.

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old John. He is married and has three children, aged 5, 8 and 12. He has two additional dependents who live with him so he can help in the education of his younger brothers. 

In 2009, John established his auto spare parts business. He began his business to be self-reliant after losing his job. His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are vehicle owners and mechanics. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,325,675 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. John has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional engine oil. He hopes that this loan can increase his stock and allow for expansion. 

In the future, John plans to improve the business and hopes to open outlets within the town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for engine oil

loans.name: Marvin Yuri

texts.es:
Marvin es un hombre de 26 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Marvin no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Carnero para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Marvin trabaja como chofer de taxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Marvin se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de la conversión a gas de su taxi, de esta manera Marvin podrá ahorrar un poco mas de dinero utilizando gas en vez de gasolina y podrá atender a mas pasajeros, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia empresa de transporte.
texts.en: Marvin is a 26-year-old man. He is single and lives in the city of Ica in the district of Parcona with this parents and his brothers. He is a friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a large desire to overcome. Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources, and since he has had to work since he was very young, Marvin was not able to study the profession of mechanical engineering that he would have wished. In his free time, he likes to play soccer and sometimes cooks a delicious lamb stew to share with his family. Of his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Marvin works as a taxi driver, providing transport service in his city. He works every day for about 12 hours and believes that things are going well for him because he knows the areas where he can find the greatest number of passengers. Marvin is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the support provided he will be able to cover the costs of converting his taxi to natural gas. In this way, Marvin will be able to save a little more money using natural gas instead of gasoline and will be able to serve more passengers. So, he will continue working and exerting himself to achieve his big dream of having his own transport company.

loans.use: to cover the costs of converting his taxi to natural gas.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número 2º ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una, donde 3 de ellas  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza procurando por salir adelante y crecer.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ninfa, quien tambien es la presidenta del grupo, ella siempre incentiva a sus compañeras y las anima a seguir con sus proyectos y metas. Ella por su parte vende prendas de todo tipo y así está teniendo los medios para ir creciendo. Su meta es seguir trabajando e ir mejorando su ingreso para seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas, como ser remeras, buzos, camperas, poleras y demás, para poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en: The group called Mujeres Unidas (United Women) is in its second loan cycle. The women are doing the poverty elimination survey to know each woman's situation and three of them fall below the poverty line. They are trying to get ahead and grow. One of the members is Ninfa, who is also president of the group. She is always motivating her fellow members to continue with their projects and goals. For her part, she sells clothing of all types and in this way has the means to grow. Her goal is to continue working and improve her income to continue helping her family. She is requesting this loan to buy clothes such as t-shirts, overalls, jackets, polo shirts etc. to continue being able to make her sales.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, overalls, jackets, polo shirts etc.

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es: Doña Martha de 62 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 30 años su principal siembra es el maíz y maicillo comercializa sus productos en las agencias de granos básicos,  con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presenta en su hogar. Doña Martha solicita un crédito para poder comprar  insumos necesarios como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, etc. para obtener mejores cosechas y asi poderle darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Martha is 62 years old. She was been a farmer for 30 years. Her principal crop is corn and sorghum. She sells her product to the staple grain agencies. With the profit she earns from her sales, she is able to cover her household expenses. Martha is requesting a loan to be able to buy needed inputs such as fertilizers, manure, seeds etc. in order to obtain better harvests and in this way give her family more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds etc.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita tiene 55 años de edad esta divorciada, y ha tenido que salir adelante sola, vive en compañía de una de sus hijas.Anita se dedica a la venta de productos de cosméticos y en ocasiones a la venta de ropa, hace 5 años tras su separación con su esposo se inicio en este negocio buscando mejorar su calidad de vida y percibir sus propios ingresos, es así como ella salio y saco adelante a sus hijas.Al principio se le hizo muy difícil ya que no contaban con liquidez económica para la compra de los productos, y no tenia el lugar indicado para el negocio pero gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su familia logro abrir su negocio.Como una mujer emprendedora Anita, espera sacar adelante su pequeño negocio y hacerlo crecer de tal manera que pueda abastecer a sus clientes ofreciéndoles un mejor producto y de buena calidad.Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil para su desempeño laboral.En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1300 soles el cual lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos tales como talcos , colonias , entre otros.
texts.en: Anita is 55 years old.  She is divorced and so has had to prosper on her own, alongside one of her daughters.  Anita makes a living selling cosmetics and, on occasion, selling clothes.  Five years ago, following her separation with her husband, Anita started the business in order to improve her quality of life and to generate her own income.  It is with this work that she and her daughters have moved forward in life.  In the beginning, this was all very difficult and Anita did not have the money to buy products and she did not have a place for the business.  Thanks to her efforts and her family's support, though, she managed to start her own business.  Anita is enterprising and hopes her business will prosper and expand enough to provide her customers with better products of good quality.  This is Anita's first loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for this financial opportunity.  The loan will be useful as she carries on her work.  Anita is applying for 1300 Nuevo Soles to buy cosmetic products, such as talcum powder, colognes and more.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products, such as talcum powder, colognes and more.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is applying for a $1,000 loan from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 28 years old, is married and has four children. She runs a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock for her store such as noodles, fish canels, sugar, coffee, salt, cigarettes, milk and eggs. Anita is living in a town nearby the school; her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people, including students, come to buy her items. She makes good money from selling her stock and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell in her kiosk.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 45 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo, Luis pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, la cual ejerció por varios años brindando enseñanzas en un pequeño centro educativo, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luis trabaja como vigilante, brindando servicios de seguridad en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de una habitación en su vivienda, ya que esta se encuentra algo deteriorada y al acercarse la época de invierno desea reforzarla y mejorar su techado, de esta manera Luis tendrá mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis is a 45-year-old man who is single and lives in the city of Ica. He is a likable, hard-working and enthusiastic person, who dedicates all his efforts to getting ahead. Thanks to these efforts, Luis studied for a professional career in education. He has pursued his career for various years now, teaching at a small educational center. In his free time, he likes to read and, sometimes, to cook a rich dish called 'Seco de Pollo' to share with his family.

On his own initiative, and with great effort and dedication, Luis also works as a watchman, offering security services at an agricultural fund in his city. He works every day for approximately 10 hours and  believes that things are going well due to his efforts and to the help he offers others.

Luis is very grateful to Kiva investors, since thanks to the help they offer, he will be able to carry out improvements to a room in his home, which is currently somewhat deteriorated. Since the winter season is approaching, he wishes to reinforce and improve his roof. In this manner, Luis will have greater security and wellbeing, and he can continue working and putting forth the effort to achieve his grand dream of completing the construction of his house.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es: Don Isidoro  vive con su familia en casa propia el se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace varios años, su principal siembra es el maíz y maicillo con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar los gastos de su hogar, don Isidoro esta solicitando un crédito que le permita poder comprar abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, semilla, herramientas y todo lo necesario para tener una mejor cosecha y asi poder dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Mr. Isidoro lives with his family in his own house. He has worked in agriculture for various years. His main crops are corn and sorghum.  With the earnings he makes on his sales, he is able to cover his home expenses. Mr. Isidoro is applying for a loan that will allow him to buy manure, fertilizers, herbicides, seed, tools and everything that is necessary to have a good harvest and in that way be able to give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, herbicides, seed, and tools.

loans.name: Ganpurev

texts.en:
Mr. Ganpurev, 29 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a technician at a Christian monastery for ten years and is considered to be the best worker by his superiors. He is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future. His family resides in their own house on a plot of land. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and is in need of serious repair. 

He is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as bricks, planks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using these materials, he will repair and insulate his house. The renovated house will enable his family to reduce coal consumption and release less pollutants, contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 61 years old and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has five children. 

Lucia sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 50 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell. 

Lucia has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Lucia hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Doña Maria de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace 7 años su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol cuando ya esta lista su cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía, para luego salir a comercializarla a las agencias de compra venta de granos básicos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, doña Maria esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como: abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, etc. para tener mejores cosechas y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en: Mrs. Maria is 43 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She has been working in agriculture for 7 years. Her main crops are corn and beans. When the harvest is ready, Mrs. Maria stores it in the granaries shown in the photograph. Later she goes out to commercialize it to agencies that buy and sell basic grains. With the earnings she makes from her sales, Mrs. Maria is able to cover her home expenses. Mrs. Maria is applying for a loan to be able to buy necessary supplies, such as manure, fertilizers, seeds, and herbicides to have better harvests and increase her family’s economic stability.

loans.use: comprar abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, etc.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is married with seven children. She is 46 years old and lives in Mamanga Gamay, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Rosana has a pig-raising business. She has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns approximately 1,500 PHP. Rosana has been a member of PMPC for five years.

In the future, Rosana hopes to have enough savings for additional business capital.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed.

loans.name: Victoria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Victoria es una humilde comerciante de la ciudad de Granada quien se dedica a vender comida y ropa, es madre de 5 hijos todos mayores de edad. Desde muy joven trabaja en el mundo del comercio su primer negocio fue al venta de comida en especial su famosas sopa y nacatamales tiene mas de 10 de dedicarse a esta actividad ella quiso diversificar su negocio buscando otras formas de ingresos asi que también se dedico a vender ropa. Actualmente sobrevive con estas dos actividades y ha mantenido a su familia. 
Por estar cerca la temporada del día de las madres ella necesita el financiamiento para comprar ropa nueva y comprar materia prima para elaborar sus comidas tales como vegetales para su sopa y carnes para sus nacatamales. Ella desea tener una minitienda de ropa y perfumes y tener una comideria con una infraestructura para atender a su clientela.
texts.en:
Victoria is a modest businesswoman from the city of Granada. She works as a vendor of food and clothes. She is the mother of 5 children, all of whom are adults. Since a very young age, she has worked in the world of commerce. Her first business was in food sales. In particular, she sold her famous soup and nacatamales. She has over 10 years experience in this business. She wanted to diversify her business, seeking other forms of income so she also began to sell clothes. Currently, she makes a living from these two activities and supports her family.

Because Mother's Day is coming up (May 30 in Nicaragua), she needs a loan to buy new clothes and raw materials to prepare food, including vegetables for soup and meat for nacatamales. She wants to have a small shop to sell clothes and perfume. She also wants a small cafe where she can tend to her customers.

loans.use: to buy new clothing and and raw materials to prepare food.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is taking out a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is 25 years old and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as eggs, coffee, sugar, salt and noodles. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $60. 

Lucia is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: to buy eggs, coffee, sugar, salt and noodles.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married with only one child. She is 61 years old and lives in Mamanga Gamay, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Rosalinda has a pig-raising business. She has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns approximately 1,500 PHP to purchase sacks of feed. Rosalinda has been a member of PMPC for five years.

In the future, Rosalinda hopes to have enough savings for additional business capital.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is applying for a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She runs a business from her house by selling pants, clothes and shorts. She is married and has six children. She earns a good income from selling second-hand clothing and, with the loan, she wants to buy more stock.

Amelia lives in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she makes sales every day. She opened her second-hand shop a year ago with a working capital of $60.

loans.use: to buy pants, clothes and shorts.

loans.name: Donato

texts.en:
Donato, 53 years old, is from the village of Rizal in the province of Isabela.

Donato is a very hardworking father; he makes sure that he can sustain the daily needs of his children with the help of his wife. In order to see to the needs of his family, Donato is asking for a loan amounting to 25,000 PHP to buy sacks of rice seed and fertilizer for his farm. He always prays that in the future he can renovate their house so that they may live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Jojo

texts.en:
A 33-year-old married man, Jojo has managed a farm for eight years. He enjoys visiting his farm every morning.

Jojo is a very dedicated person: he makes sure he can provide the important things needed for his family. He is requesting a loan amounting to 25,000 PHP to buy insecticides, fertilizer and seeds to plant for his farm business.

He hopes he can sustain a quality living for his family.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizer and seeds to plant for his farm business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 56 years old. She is married and has one child. She lives in D'Ban, Calamba. 

To make a living, Milagros is engaged in the fish industry, particularly in fish-selling. She has been in this business for six years, earning a monthly income of 15,000 PHP. Milagros has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase twenty boxes of fish to deliver in the market. 

Milagros has been a member of Paglaum MPC for seven years.

loans.use: to purchase 20 boxes of fish.

loans.name: Quinos De Chutzorop Group

texts.es:
La señora Sebastiana de estado civil soltera, tiene 26 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboracion de guipiles, inició este negocio con el apoyo de su familia y hasta la fecha lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Decide organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos para poder tejer guipiles ya que actualmente tiene varios pedidos y el capital con que cuenta ya no le es suficiente, en el futuro queire que su negocio sea grande y poder ofrecer varidad de estilos en guipiles; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a artesanía.
texts.en: Sebastiana is single and 26 years old. She makes traditional hand-embroidered garments, a business she started four years ago with her family's help. She organized a group to apply for a loan, which she will use to buy thread to fulfill orders for her hand-embroidered garments, since she lacks sufficient capital. She hopes to see her business grow over time and to be able to offer different styles of garments. The other members of her communal bank make handcrafted items.

loans.use: to buy thread to make traditional cloths.

loans.name: Generardo

texts.en:
Generardo is 47 years old and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is married with only one child. 

Generardo catches fish for a living. He has been doing this for three years. He has requested a loan to purchase fishing materials. 

Generardo has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, he hopes to have enough savings for his family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
This is Helena, 57, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Diosdado, a vendor, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Helena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.


She is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Helena dreams to expand her business and hopes that her children will have a good life. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gertrudis De Jesus

texts.es:
Gertrudis, requiere de un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo de granos básicos y así preparar la tierra para llevarlo a cabo; este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a cosechar  el cultivo necesario y con ello logro mejores ingresos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Gertrudis needs another loan in order to continue planting of basic grains and to prepare the land. The loan will allow her to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and other items. 

Her previous loan helped her to harvest her last crop and with it bring in greater income. Her economic conditions and the circumstances for her family have improved greatly.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and other items.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is 39 years old, separated, and has one child. He lives in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, he owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been in his business for over nine years and earns PHP 8,500 every month. 

He joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2008, and now he has requested a loan of PHP 27,000 to purchase seedlings and fertilizer. Fidel plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
This is Thelma, 54, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Albino, a businessman, and is a mother to her eight children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Thelma operates a wholesaling store where she sells garlic, onions, ginger and mung beans.  She has been in this business for thirteen years already. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 4,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy large quantities of garlic, onions, ginger and mung beans needed in her business. 
Thelma hopes that her business will grow even more and dreams of a bright future for her family. She meets up every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of garlic, onions, ginger and mung beans needed in her business.

loans.name: Lito

texts.en:
At the age of 34, Lito is still single. Wanting to help his parents earn their living, he decided to engage in a rice farming activity. Aside from that, he also wants to save for his future family; thus, he is working double time. 

Currently, Lito is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) for him to improve his farming business. According to him, if the loan will be approved, he will use that for purchasing fertilizer and seeds for his farm. For the next two years, Lito wants to expand the farmland that he is farming. He is planning to buy another hectare of land if possible.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Ummatoy

texts.ru:
Умматой жительница Канибадама. Родилась и выросла в сельской местности. Молодая женщина, мать одиночка. Рано вышла замуж, после рождении сына, муж ушел от них и больше не вернулся. У него уже другая семья и дети.  А бедная Умматой осталась одна, с ребенком на руках.  Вернулась к родителям, но и тут было не сладко. Но жить придется, только ради своего ребенка и мысли о счастливой семьи ей дали надежду и силу. Она поначалу пошла в местный колхоз, и с утра до вечера, не жалея себя работала в поле. За накопленные деньги она купила себе маленькую дойную корову. Немного откормила и сейчас ее корова стала большой, и дает ей в день более 10 литров молока. Продавая их, она покупает себе и своему сыночку ежедневные продукты.
 По советам подруг она обратилась за помощью в Арванд. Она хочет увеличить поголовья своего скота. Для этого ей нужны деньги. А такой крупной суммы у нее на руках нет.   На полученный кредит Умматой планирует купить скот.  Она очень надеется что накопив денег сможет купить себе квартиру и жить отдельно от родителей. Заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Ummatoy lives in Kanibadam. She was born and grew up in a rural area. She is a young single mother. She got married early; after her son was born, her husband left the family and never came back. By now he has a new family and other children. Poor Ummatoy  was left to raise her child alone. She returned to her parents, but that was hard on her as well. Yet one has to go on living, if just for the sake of the child; dreams of a happy family strengthened Ummatoy and gave her hope. At first she started working at the local collective farm, and worked the land from morning till night, sparing no effort. She was able to save some money and buy a dairy cow. She has been fattening this cow for a while; now her cow has gained weight and brings in over 10 liters of milk per day. Ummatoy sells the milk and buys items of first necessity for herself and her little son.

On her girlfriends’ advice, she reached out to Arvand for help. She would like to get more cattle. She needs funds for this, but does not have enough cash. Ummatoy plans to use her loan to buy cattle. She really hopes   to save enough money in order to buy an apartment and live separately from her parents. She thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy  cattle.

loans.name: Luis Gerardo

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 36 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Luis no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional Agronomía que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luis se dedica a la agricultura, el tiene una pequeña parcela donde cultiva zapallo, el trabaja todos los días realizando labores de campo y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Luis se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de abono, riego y cosecha de su cultivo, de esta manera Luis espera realizar una buena venta de los zapallos que obtenga, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su cultivo.
texts.en:
Luis, 36, is single and lives in the city of Camaná. He is friendly, hardworking, enthusiastic, and determined to get ahead. Luis was unable to study agronomy as he wished because he lacked money and had to start working at an early age to help his parents. In his free time, he likes to play soccer with friends and occasionally prepare a delicious traditional chicken dish to share with his family. 

Luis farms on his own initiative and with dedication. He has a small plot where he grows squash. He works in the field every day for about 10 hours. Luis enjoys his work and thinks it is going well because of his experience and kindness toward others. 

Luis thanks the Kiva lenders, whose help will allow him to cover the costs of fertilizing, watering, and harvesting his crop. Luis expects great sales from his squash harvest. This will let him keep working and striving to achieve his great dream to increase his output.

loans.use: to pay to fertilize, water, and harvest his crops.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a widow with three children. Shirley is 51 years old and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Shirley plans to have a sari-sari (convenience store) to earn a living, and this is her new business. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and canned goods.

Shirley is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Shirley hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and canned goods.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is 51 years old and married with two children. She lives in Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been doing this business for five years. In 2008, she joined GDMPC Microcredit to gain access to microfinance, and she is now requesting 54,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to cultivate her vacant farm area to generate additional income to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Liberta

texts.en: Liberta is 58 years old, married and blessed with six children. She lives in Tugas, Baliangao. Liberta has a business selling bananas. She has had this business for two years and earns a monthly income of 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase 1,000 kilos of assorted kinds of bananas to sell. Liberta has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 2011.

loans.use: To purchase 1,000 kilos of assorted kinds of bananas.

loans.name: Ramon De Jesus

texts.es:
Ramón, 48 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Granada de oficio comerciante es dueño de una pulpería tiene un hijo de 25 años. Antes él era músico tocaba en eventos y reuniones en un grupo pero desde hace más 5 años que puso su pulpería solo se dedica a este negocio con el cual mantiene a su familia y los gastos del hogar. 
Su propósito es convertir su pulpería es una miscelánea bien surtida de productos alimenticios. Hoy está requiriendo financiamiento para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, papel higiénico, snacks. Con ayuda del crédito podrá surtir un poco más su pulpería y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ramón, 48, lives in the city of Granada and has a 25-year-old son. He is a salesman and owns a grocery store. Before, he was a musician and played with a group at events or gatherings, but more than five years ago he opened the store and this is now his only activity and how he supports his family and pays for the home expenses.

His goal is to turn his small grocery store into a larger store with a wider variety of food products. He is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, toilet paper and snacks. With this help, he will be able to stock his store and offer his clients a wider variety.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, toilet paper and snacks.

loans.name: Andres Emiliano

texts.es:
Andres es un hombre de 51 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Andres no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas, en sus ratos libres le gusta criar cuyes y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Andres trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Andres se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea construir una pared de adobe en la parte trasera de su casa, ya que actualmente está cubierta con maderas y cañas, de esta Andres tendrá mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un negocio de venta de pasteles.
texts.en:
Andres, 51, is single and lives in the city of Cañete in the Imperial district. He is friendly, hardworking, enthusiastic, and determined to get ahead. Andres was not able to study systems engineering because he lacked money and had to start working at an early age to help his parents. In his free time, he raises guinea pigs and occasionally prepares a delicious, traditional meat and potato stew to share with his family.

Andres works hard and with dedication as a farmhand for a municipal agriculture program. He works for about 10 hours every day and feels that things are going well because his performance is good and he treats others kindly. 

Andres thanks Kiva lenders, whose support will allow him to renovate his house. He wants to build an adobe wall at the back to replace the one made of wood and straw.  Andres will be safer, and his well-being will improve. He will be able to keep working and striving to achieve his great dream to have a pastry business.

loans.use: to improve his house.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
This is Leticia. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 49,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leticia hopes to have more customers and dreams to see her family serving God. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a sewing business from her house. She is making a good income from sewing and, with the loan, she wants to buy more items that are needed.

She is living in a town by the main road, so many people come to her sewing business and she is open every day. She opened her business two years ago with her own working capital of $50.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
This is Sherly. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, and for their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan of 19,000 PHP for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Sherly's profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sherly dreams that her business will continue to be successful and hopes to give her child a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Etelfina

texts.en: Etelfina is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy gasoline. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $100. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 50 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married with two adult-age and two school-age children.

Delia  has an internet and rice business and earns approximately PHP 10,000.00 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to to pay her son's tuition fees.

Delia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Delia hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Ek Phnom district, where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Channa is aged 53 years and widowed with two children. As a widow, she has struggled to feed her children by farming rice. Having been in the business for 20 years, the current business earns her approximately 26,000 KHR per day.

Channa is with VisionFund for this loan cycle. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan of 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use another portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is from Garang, Tangub City. She is 22 years old. Edna is single. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a fishing business catching and selling fish. Edna has been engaged in her business for two years and earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2010, Edna joined GDMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional sets of fishing nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to repair her existing boat.

loans.use: to purchase additional sets of  fishing nets.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.en:
